actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 3:00 p.m. on January 16, 2026.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Kiley (CA) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.

Mr. McCormick asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns on January 15, 2026, it adjourn to meet at 3 p.m. on Friday, January 16, 2026, and when the House adjourns on that day, it adjourn to meet at noon on Tuesday, January 20, 2026 for Morning-Hour debate and 2 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 213
actions-list.actionItem: 205 (Roll no. 31).

actions-list.header: On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 206
actions-list.actionItem: 210 (Roll no. 30).
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Kaptur moved to recommit to the Committee on Education and Workforce.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Huizenga amendment; Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 395
actions-list.actionItem: 22 (Roll no. 29).
The previous question was ordered on the amendment and the bill pursuant to the rule.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 988, the House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Huizenga amendment No. 1.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Huizenga,  numbered 1 printed in Part A of House Report 119-440 to require the Government Accountability Office to publish a study on brokerage accounts.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 2988.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2988, H.R. 2262, H.R. 2270, H.R. 2312 and H.R. 4366. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 2988 under a structured rule, and H.R. 2262, H.R. 2270, H.R. 2312, and H.R. 4366 under a closed rule. The rule provides for one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 988. H.R. 2988 â€” "To amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to specify requirements concerning the consideration of pecuniary and non-pecuniary factors, and for other purposes."
The Chair designated Mr. Casten to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
